abstract: New York City reaches tentative agreement with Uniformed Firefighters Association for seven-year contract; if deal is ratified by members, police and corrections officers will be only remaining groups of uniformed city employees working under expired contracts.
lead_paragraph: If ratified by the Uniformed Firefighters Association, the deal would leave only police and correction officers working under expired contracts.

headline.main: Tentative Labor Pact Reached With New York Firefighters’ Union
headline.print_headline: A Tentative Labor Deal for the City’s Firefighters

snippet: If ratified by the Uniformed Firefighters Association, the deal would leave only police and correction officers working under expired contracts.
